alert.note: Alert for Boulder; Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 2:36PM MDT until June 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in north central Colorado, Larimer. In northeast Colorado, Boulder and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 236 PM MDT, There are multiple videos of stalled cars due to accumulating hail and flooding. Urban and small stream flooding is occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Fort Collins, northwestern Arvada, western Westminster, Boulder, Longmont, Loveland, southwestern Broomfield, Lafayette, Louisville, Superior, Berthoud, Lyons, Niwot, Carter Lake, Crisman, Cedar Cove, Eldorado Springs, Masonville, Rocky Flats and Hygiene.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, highways and underpasses. Additionally, country roads, farmlands along the banks of creeks, and other low lying areas are subject to flooding.
